com.redhat.rhn.frontend.servlets
Class PxtSessionDelegateImpl

java.lang.Object
  com.redhat.rhn.frontend.servlets.PxtSessionDelegateImpl
All Implemented Interfaces:
PxtSessionDelegate
public class PxtSessionDelegateImpl
extends java.lang.Object
implements PxtSessionDelegate

PxtSessionDelegateImpl is an implementation of PxtSessionDelegate that wraps a RequestContext object.

See Also:
PxtSessionDelegate, RequestContext

PxtSessionDelegateImpl

protected PxtSessionDelegateImpl()
Method Detail

getPxtSession

public WebSession getPxtSession(HttpServletRequest request)
Retrieve the pxt session. If the session does not exist, one will be created. The session will be bound to a request attribute named session.

Specified by:
getPxtSession in interface PxtSessionDelegate
Parameters:
request - The current request
Returns:
The pxt session to which the request is bound.

getWebUserId

public java.lang.Long getWebUserId(HttpServletRequest request)
Returns the webUserId property of the pxt session bound to the specified request.

Specified by:
getWebUserId in interface PxtSessionDelegate
Parameters:
request - The current request
Returns:
The webUserId property of the pxt session.

updateWebUserId

public void updateWebUserId(HttpServletRequest request,
                            HttpServletResponse response,
                            java.lang.Long id)
Sets the webUserId property of the pxt session bound to the specified request. Note that this operation triggers a session refresh.

Specified by:
updateWebUserId in interface PxtSessionDelegate
Parameters:
request - The current request
response - The current response
id - The ID to be assigned to the webUserId property.
See Also:
PxtSessionDelegate.refreshPxtSession(HttpServletRequest, HttpServletResponse)

isPxtSessionExpired

public boolean isPxtSessionExpired(HttpServletRequest request)
Return true if the pxt session for the current request has expired.

Specified by:
isPxtSessionExpired in interface PxtSessionDelegate
Parameters:
request - The current request
Returns:
true if the pxt session for the current request has expired, false otherwise

isPxtSessionKeyValid

public boolean isPxtSessionKeyValid(HttpServletRequest request)
Validates the pxt session ID that is stored in the pxt cookie with a secret key in the pxt session. Return true if the encoded session ID matches the secret key.

Specified by:
isPxtSessionKeyValid in interface PxtSessionDelegate
Parameters:
request - The current request
Returns:
true if the encoded session ID matches the secret key, false otherwise.

loadPxtSession

protected void loadPxtSession(HttpServletRequest request)
Loads the pxt session and stores it in the request as an attribute named session. If the pxt session is not already present in the request, it is fetched from the database if the pxt cookie is available. If the pxt cookie is not available, a new pxt session is created.

Parameters:
request - The current request.

getPxtSessionId

protected java.lang.Long getPxtSessionId(HttpServletRequest request)
Parses the pxt session id out of the pxt cookie if it included in the request.

Parameters:
request - The current request.
Returns:
The pxt session id parsed out of the pxt cookie, if the cookie is included in the request. Return null if the pxt cookie is not found or if the key is invalid.

findPxtSessionById

protected WebSession findPxtSessionById(java.lang.Long id)
Retrieves the pxt session with the given ID. This method simply wraps a call to WebSessionFactory. This makes it easier to write tests that can avoid calls to WebSessionFactory, which would result in database calls.

Parameters:
id - The session ID to search by.
Returns:
The pxt session or null if no session is found.
See Also:
WebSessionFactory.lookupById(Long)

createPxtSession

protected WebSession createPxtSession()
Creates a new pxt session. This method simply wraps a call to SessionManager . This makes it easier to write tests that can avoid calls to SessionManager, which would result in database calls.

Returns:
A new pxt session.
See Also:
SessionManager.makeSession(Long, long)

refreshPxtSession

public void refreshPxtSession(HttpServletRequest request,
                              HttpServletResponse response)
Refreshes the pxt session, effectively reseting the timeout of the session. Specifically, implementations of PxtSessionDelegate are responsible for the following:
  • Set the expires property of the session to an appropriate value.
  • Save the session.
  • Store a pxt cookie in the response with an appropriate timeout.

Specified by:
refreshPxtSession in interface PxtSessionDelegate
Parameters:
request - The current request
response - The current response

savePxtSession

protected void savePxtSession(WebSession pxtSession)
This method is a hook for testing.

Parameters:
pxtSession - The session to be saved

invalidatePxtSession

public void invalidatePxtSession(HttpServletRequest request,
                                 HttpServletResponse response)
Invalidates the pxt session for the given request.

Specified by:
invalidatePxtSession in interface PxtSessionDelegate
Parameters:
request - The current request
response - The current response
